text: Wedbush Securities says Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) could be a major winner if a U.S.-India trade pact comes through, boosting the tech giant's supply chain in India. Analyst Dan Ives reiterated an Outperform rating and kept his $270 price target, citing India's expanding manufacturing capabilities as a strategic counterweight to China's dominance. President Donald Trump has warned that iPhones assembled overseas could face a 25% tariff if not made domestically, a levy he said might extend to Samsung (SSNLF) and other phone manufacturers by the end of June.

headline: Trust the process, not the pitch
text: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. In the latest episode of Trader Talk, Kenny Polcari sits down with Chris Versace, chief investment officer at Tematica Research, to discuss how thematic investing can help navigate today’s volatile markets. Versace shares insights into identifying structural changes like AI, digital infrastructure, and sustainability, as well as building portfolios aligned with these long-term trends. They also touch on the recent rebound in tech, rising trade tensions, and shifting earnings expectations, concluding that clear strategies and adaptability are key to success in uncertain times.
